ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: 'Peace!' A word from a Merciful Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Peace" shall be the greeting from the merciful Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: “Peace” shall be the word conveyed to them from their Merciful Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Peace be with you," will be a greeting for them from the Merciful Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Upon them will be “Peace” – a Word from their Merciful Lord!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: (It will be said to them): "Salam (Peace!)" -- a Word from the Lord, Most Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Peace: a word from a Merciful Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Peace!' -- such is the greeting, from a Lord All-compassionate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The word from a Merciful Lord (for them) is: Peace!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Peace!" shall be the greeting from the Merciful Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Peace shall be the word from the Lord Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Peace!" - a word (of salutation) from a Lord Most Merciful!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (It will be said to them): Salamun (peace be on you), a Word from the Lord (Allah), Most Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Peace, a saying from the Most Merciful Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Peace—a saying from a Most Merciful Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [And] "Peace," a word from a Merciful Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:58] “Peace!” (salāmun is a subject) — the word (qawlan is its predicate), that is, [peace] by way of a word, from a Lord [Who is] Merciful, to them, in other words, He says to them, ‘Peace be on you!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The word from a Merciful Lord (for them) is: Peace) they are greeted with the greeting of peace!
